intro: Erodium ciconium, commonly known as the water chickweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with slender stems and small, pink or white flowers. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and bloom from spring to early summer. Erodium ciconium is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
